name: Line 88
description:
To offer the best playing experience, it is advised to download the game rather than playing it in browser.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Movement controls: W A S D or arrow keys to move, Enter or Space-bar to advance text.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

When Nao happens to run into his old classmate Siren during a bus ride, he has a bad intuition. This intuition proofs correctly, when suddenly, all the lights in the bus start flickering and everyone else disappears. Confused, the two young men try to leave the bus, only to realize, that it may not be so easy. And worse; they may not be alone. Will they find a way out before "it" swallows them whole?

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Line 88 is a short kinetic novel with walking elements. It takes about 20 minutes to complete and has elements of horror. There are no choices. Just let the story unfold as you dive deeper into the void. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------

A game by Hatoge

made in RPGMaker MV

The assets were drawn traditionally in pencil and watercolors and then scanned in and edited to be used in the game.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

This game may not work on your device if it is low spec and/or old, despite being a RPGMaker game. This is due to some plugins. It may work better in browser, but I cannot guarantee that everyone can play this game, my apologies.

------------------------------------------------------------------------

You are welcome to stream or record this game, however I ask that you don't edit my logo and the content warning screen at the beginning, as well as the credits, out of the video. They are both very short segments

------------------------------------------------------------------------

I am happy to accept translations for this game, so if you are interested, you can dm me on twitter. Please note that you will need a version of RPGMaker MV for the translation.
